intro: Cheiridopsis papillata, commonly known as the Papillate Ice Plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that store water, adapted to its arid environment. It produces clusters of yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring. Cheiridopsis papillata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
